page.title: 17Saugh Hill-Uses of plants
page.content: Many of the plants growing on the Saugh Hill were widely used in the past. {Softbrush}is a grass with long stems which were used as wicks for oil lamps in the days before electricity. Another grass,{heathbed straw},was often put in mattresses and was said to be very comfortable to lie on! It also smelt like mown hay when dried which would have been a pleasant smell in old houses. Several plants were medicinal. For example{heath speedwell}was used as a tonic,{tormentil}soothed aches and pains and{sphagnum moss}was used as a dressing for wounds ( and by Eskimos for nappies! ). There are also some edible plants including{sorrel, bilberries and {milkwort}which curdles milk.
